title: Default Parameters
content:
## What are Default Parameters?

**Default parameters** have preset values that are used when no argument is provided. They make function arguments optional.

## Basic Syntax

```python
def greet(name="World"):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("Alice")  # Hello, Alice!
greet()         # Hello, World! (uses default)
```

## Multiple Default Parameters

```python
def create_profile(name, age=0, city="Unknown"):
    print(f"Name: {name}")
    print(f"Age: {age}")
    print(f"City: {city}")

create_profile("Alice", 25, "NYC")   # All provided
create_profile("Bob", 30)            # city uses default
create_profile("Charlie")            # age and city use defaults
```

## Parameter Order Rule

Default parameters must come AFTER non-default parameters:

```python
# Correct
def greet(name, greeting="Hello"):
    print(f"{greeting}, {name}!")

# Wrong - causes SyntaxError
# def greet(greeting="Hello", name):
#     print(f"{greeting}, {name}!")
```

## Common Use Cases

### Configuration Options

```python
def connect_database(host, port=5432, timeout=30):
    print(f"Connecting to {host}:{port}")
    print(f"Timeout: {timeout} seconds")

connect_database("localhost")
connect_database("db.example.com", 3306)
connect_database("db.example.com", 3306, 60)
```

### Formatting Functions

```python
def format_price(amount, currency="$", decimals=2):
    return f"{currency}{amount:.{decimals}f}"

print(format_price(19.99))           # $19.99
print(format_price(19.99, "EUR "))    # EUR 19.99
print(format_price(19.99, "$", 0))   # $20
```

### Optional Behavior

```python
def print_items(items, numbered=False, prefix=""):
    for i, item in enumerate(items, 1):
        if numbered:
            print(f"{prefix}{i}. {item}")
        else:
            print(f"{prefix}{item}")

fruits = ["Apple", "Banana", "Cherry"]
print_items(fruits)
print_items(fruits, True)
print_items(fruits, True, "  ")
```

## Boolean Defaults

```python
def search(query, case_sensitive=False, whole_word=False):
    print(f"Searching: {query}")
    print(f"Case sensitive: {case_sensitive}")
    print(f"Whole word: {whole_word}")

search("python")
search("Python", True)
search("Python", True, True)
```

## Warning: Mutable Default Arguments

Never use mutable objects (lists, dicts) as defaults:

```python
# WRONG - Bug!
def add_item(item, items=[]):
    items.append(item)
    return items

print(add_item("a"))  # ['a']
print(add_item("b"))  # ['a', 'b'] - Unexpected!

# CORRECT - Use None
def add_item(item, items=None):
    if items is None:
        items = []
    items.append(item)
    return items

print(add_item("a"))  # ['a']
print(add_item("b"))  # ['b'] - Correct!
```

## Combining with Keyword Arguments

```python
def create_user(username, email, active=True, role="user"):
    return {
        "username": username,
        "email": email,
        "active": active,
        "role": role
    }

# Skip middle defaults using keyword arguments
user = create_user("john", "john@example.com", role="admin")
print(user)
```

## Practical Example: Text Formatter

```python
def format_text(text, uppercase=False, add_border=False, border_char="*"):
    if uppercase:
        text = text.upper()
    
    if add_border:
        width = len(text) + 4
        border = border_char * width
        text = f"{border}\n{border_char} {text} {border_char}\n{border}"
    
    return text

print(format_text("hello"))
print(format_text("hello", uppercase=True))
print(format_text("hello", add_border=True))
print(format_text("hello", True, True, "#"))
```

# Default Parameters
# Make function arguments optional

# Basic default parameter
def greet(name="World"):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("Alice")  # Uses provided argument
greet()          # Uses default value

# Multiple defaults
def create_coffee(size="medium", milk=False, sugar=0):
    order = f"{size.title()} coffee"
    if milk:
        order += " with milk"
    if sugar > 0:
        order += f" and {sugar} sugar(s)"
    print(f"Order: {order}")

create_coffee()
create_coffee("large")
create_coffee("small", True, 2)
